content: Singaporean politician **Cai Yinzhou**[a] (born 16 October 1990) is a Singaporean politician who was elected to the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) in the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election). He represents Toa Payoh Central division of the [Bishan–Toa Payoh Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Bishan%E2%80%93Toa_Payoh_Group_Representation_Constituency) as a member of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party). ## Career Prior to entering politics, Cai was a social entrepreneur and he was named as the 2020 Strait Times Singaporean of the Year. ### Political career In the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election), Cai was fielded in Bishan–Toa Payoh GRC led by Anchor Minister [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat) to replace retiring Defence Minister [Ng Eng Hen](/wiki/Ng_Eng_Hen). His team would win with 75% of the vote. ## Notes [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)Preceded by[Chong Kee Hiong](/wiki/Chong_Kee_Hiong) [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat) [Ng Eng Hen](/wiki/Ng_Eng_Hen) [Saktiandi Supaat](/wiki/Saktiandi_Supaat) **Member of Parliament for [Bishan–Toa Payoh GRC](/wiki/Bishan%E2%80%93Toa_Payoh_Group_Representation_Constituency)** 2025 – present Served alongside: **(2025 – present): [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat), [Elysa Chen](/wiki/Elysa_Chen), [Saktiandi Supaat](/wiki/Saktiandi_Supaat)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Cai Yinzhou
